title: How to Make Oat Crackers
category_hierarchy: Crackers and Savory Cookies and Biscuits

steps.headline: Preheat your oven.
steps.description: Set it to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (175 degrees Celsius). Let it preheat. While it does, prepare a large baking sheet so your crackers don’t stick to it while baking. Use a paper towel to rub enough shortening, butter, or vegetable oil to lightly coat the whole sheet.

steps.headline: Blend your oats.
steps.description: Place your rolled oats in your blender or food processor. Use the pulse setting to blend them into flour, a few seconds at a time. Check in between each pulse to judge the flour’s consistency. Quit while it’s still coarse, rather than continue blending it into a fine powder.

steps.headline: Make your dough.
steps.description: Add the other dry ingredients to the blender or food processor: whole wheat flour,  salt, white sugar, and ground cinnamon. Stir until they are evenly mixed. Then add your wet ingredients: water and olive oil. Stir again until all ingredients have combined into a soft dough.

steps.headline: Shape your crackers.
steps.description: Transfer the dough to your baking sheet. Use a rolling pin to spread and flatten it until it is about an eighth of an inch thick (0.3 cm). Then use a knife to create perforations for each cracker. Create any shape you want, but don’t slice all the way through the dough. Instead, just create lines roughly halfway deep through it.

steps.headline: Bake your crackers.
steps.description: Once the oven reaches desired heat, transfer the baking sheet inside. Bake for about 10 to 15 minutes. Keep a close watch on them as they near the 10-minute mark, because they can start burning very quickly. Remove from heat once they begin to brown a little.

steps.headline: Break your crackers.
steps.description: First, set the baking sheet down on a heat-protected surface. Let the crackers cool until they are safe to touch. Then simply break them into individual crackers along your perforations.

steps.headline: Preheat your oven.
steps.description: First, turn your oven on to 375 degrees Fahrenheit (191 degrees Celsius). While that heats up, get a large baking sheet ready for your crackers. Dust it with a light layer of all-purpose flour to prevent your dough from sticking to the sheet.

steps.headline: Chop your oats.
steps.description: Add your rolled oats to your blender or food processor. Pulse them several times, checking for consistency in between each pulse. Stop once they appear finely chopped.

steps.headline: Form your dough.
steps.description: Add the following dry ingredients to the blender or processor: all-purpose flour; salt; ground black pepper; chopped rosemary leaves; baking powder. Then chop up your cold butter into small pieces and add those, too. Continue to pulse a few times to form a coarse, mealy dough. Then add your milk and pulse for roughly 15 seconds without pausing.

steps.headline: Cut out your crackers.
steps.description: Place the dough on your baking sheet. Then roll it out with a rolling pin until the dough is about an eighth of an inch thick (0.3 cm). Use a knife to cut out 60 crackers, slicing all the way through the dough. Spread them out so there is about an inch (2.5 cm) between each one.

steps.headline: Bake your crackers.
steps.description: Place the sheet in the oven and bake for 12 to 15 minutes. Remove from heat once the bottoms turn a light brown. Allow them to cool on a rack to room temperature before serving.

steps.headline: Preheat your oven.
steps.description: First, set your oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit (191 degrees Celsius). Then line a large baking sheet with parchment paper. Set that aside to transfer your dough to once it’s ready.

steps.headline: Prepare your dough.
steps.description: In a large mixing bowl, stir together your rolled oats, salt, and seeds: raw pumpkin; raw sunflower; sesame; chia; poppy. In a second bowl, combine your wet ingredients: vegetable oil, maple syrup, and lukewarm water. Pour the wet ingredients over the dry ones, then toss the dough so it becomes thoroughly soaked.

steps.headline: Roll your dough.
steps.description: First, give the dough about 10 minutes so the wet and dry ingredients combine and thicken. Then use your hands to roll it into a ball. Set in on your baking sheet. Top it with a second sheet of parchment paper. Then use a rolling pin to spread and flatten it until it is about an eighth of an inch thick (0.3 cm).

steps.headline: Bake on both sides.
steps.description: First, remove the second sheet of parchment paper from the dough’s top. Transfer the baking sheet to the oven and bake for 15 to 20 minutes, or until the edges golden to brown. Set the sheet down on a heat-protected surface and use a spatula to remove the cracker dough, plus the parchment paper underneath. Discard the old paper, line the sheet with new paper, and flip the dough over. Bake a second time for another 15 to 20 minutes. Once it cools to room temperature, use your hands to snap it into smaller pieces. For neater cuts, try using a cleaver and cutting board.

text: Baking Cinnamon-Spiced Crackers Preheat your oven. Set it to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (175 degrees Celsius). Let it preheat. While it does, prepare a large baking sheet so your crackers don’t stick to it while baking. Use a paper towel to rub enough shortening, butter, or vegetable oil to lightly coat the whole sheet. Blend your oats. Place your rolled oats in your blender or food processor. Use the pulse setting to blend them into flour, a few seconds at a time. Check in between each pulse to judge the flour’s consistency. Quit while it’s still coarse, rather than continue blending it into a fine powder. Make your dough. Add the other dry ingredients to the blender or food processor: whole wheat flour,  salt, white sugar, and ground cinnamon. Stir until they are evenly mixed. Then add your wet ingredients: water and olive oil. Stir again until all ingredients have combined into a soft dough. Shape your crackers. Transfer the dough to your baking sheet. Use a rolling pin to spread and flatten it until it is about an eighth of an inch thick (0.3 cm). Then use a knife to create perforations for each cracker. Create any shape you want, but don’t slice all the way through the dough. Instead, just create lines roughly halfway deep through it. Bake your crackers. Once the oven reaches desired heat, transfer the baking sheet inside. Bake for about 10 to 15 minutes. Keep a close watch on them as they near the 10-minute mark, because they can start burning very quickly. Remove from heat once they begin to brown a little. Break your crackers. First, set the baking sheet down on a heat-protected surface. Let the crackers cool until they are safe to touch. Then simply break them into individual crackers along your perforations. Making Peppered Rosemary Crackers Preheat your oven. First, turn your oven on to 375 degrees Fahrenheit (191 degrees Celsius). While that heats up, get a large baking sheet ready for your crackers. Dust it with a light layer of all-purpose flour to prevent your dough from sticking to the sheet. Chop your oats. Add your rolled oats to your blender or food processor. Pulse them several times, checking for consistency in between each pulse. Stop once they appear finely chopped. Form your dough. Add the following dry ingredients to the blender or processor: all-purpose flour; salt; ground black pepper; chopped rosemary leaves; baking powder. Then chop up your cold butter into small pieces and add those, too. Continue to pulse a few times to form a coarse, mealy dough. Then add your milk and pulse for roughly 15 seconds without pausing. Cut out your crackers. Place the dough on your baking sheet. Then roll it out with a rolling pin until the dough is about an eighth of an inch thick (0.3 cm). Use a knife to cut out 60 crackers, slicing all the way through the dough. Spread them out so there is about an inch (2.5 cm) between each one. Bake your crackers. Place the sheet in the oven and bake for 12 to 15 minutes. Remove from heat once the bottoms turn a light brown. Allow them to cool on a rack to room temperature before serving. Making Oat Crackers with Seeds Preheat your oven. First, set your oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit (191 degrees Celsius). Then line a large baking sheet with parchment paper. Set that aside to transfer your dough to once it’s ready. Prepare your dough. In a large mixing bowl, stir together your rolled oats, salt, and seeds: raw pumpkin; raw sunflower; sesame; chia; poppy. In a second bowl, combine your wet ingredients: vegetable oil, maple syrup, and lukewarm water. Pour the wet ingredients over the dry ones, then toss the dough so it becomes thoroughly soaked. Roll your dough. First, give the dough about 10 minutes so the wet and dry ingredients combine and thicken. Then use your hands to roll it into a ball. Set in on your baking sheet. Top it with a second sheet of parchment paper. Then use a rolling pin to spread and flatten it until it is about an eighth of an inch thick (0.3 cm). Bake on both sides. First, remove the second sheet of parchment paper from the dough’s top. Transfer the baking sheet to the oven and bake for 15 to 20 minutes, or until the edges golden to brown. Set the sheet down on a heat-protected surface and use a spatula to remove the cracker dough, plus the parchment paper underneath. Discard the old paper, line the sheet with new paper, and flip the dough over. Bake a second time for another 15 to 20 minutes. Once it cools to room temperature, use your hands to snap it into smaller pieces. For neater cuts, try using a cleaver and cutting board.
